poem:
Title: A Struggle in Crimson and Silver

Silver slips through grasping hands,
An offshore dance in HMRC's barren lands.
Frauds in fine suits, escaping the net,
Their wealth in havens, untouched and unmet.

The chest of thieving crows lies bare,
No justice-seeds planted there.
A campaign's cry muffled,
by taxes un-shuffled.

As evasion reigns
Revenue wanes
In crimson mourning -
A new day is dawning.
